list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They reached the summit of the mountain at midday
At the age of thirty he was at the summit of his powers as a composer.

list_definition.definition: (of a conference etc) at the highest level of international negotiation, at which heads of state meet for discussion.

list_ex_of_english: Individual summits are important, but they are not enough.
Among the many demonstrations, the mini-summits, the youth summits and various activities which are planned, there will be a major demonstration by the fishing community.
Nothing is achieved by much talking and putting on great summits and at the same time allocating less money.
We should keep in mind the achievement of the summit's aim, namely limiting the emission of harmful compounds.
Otherwise, we will have summits with no real content, and that would not be good either.
What plans he has to hold regular rail summits with the rail operators.
On the question of process, we must undoubtedly stop future summits being the trade equivalent of a travelling circus.
Competition at any price, runaway loss of security, cynical and relentless power struggles, consensuses reached at summits, behind closed doors: it is no longer acceptable!
